step1.title: Submit Application
step1.description: Complete and submit the admission application form along with all required documents. Applications can be submitted online or in person at our admission office.

step2.description: Attend the entrance examination covering academic subjects and basic Islamic knowledge. The assessment is designed to evaluate the student's readiness for our integrated curriculum.

step3.description: Participate in a brief interview with our admission committee. This includes both student and parent/guardian interaction to ensure alignment with our educational philosophy.

step4.title: Admission Confirmation
step4.description: Receive admission decision and complete enrollment formalities including fee payment and document verification. Welcome to the Madrasatul Quran family!

q1.question: What is the minimum age requirement for admission?
q1.answer: Students must be at least 5 years old for Class I admission. Age requirements vary by class level, and we follow the national education board guidelines for age-appropriate enrollment.

q2.question: Is there an entrance examination for all classes?
q2.answer: Yes, all students must take an entrance examination covering basic academic subjects and Islamic knowledge appropriate to their applying class level. The exam helps us assess the student's readiness for our integrated curriculum.

q3.question: What documents are required for the admission process?
q3.answer: Required documents include: completed application form, birth certificate, academic transcripts, transfer certificate (if applicable), medical certificate, and recent photographs. All documents must be original with photocopies.

q4.question: Are scholarships available for deserving students?
q4.answer: Yes, we offer merit-based scholarships (up to 25% discount), need-based financial aid (up to 50% discount), sibling discounts (10% per additional child), and special support for orphaned students (up to 75% discount).

q5.question: Can I visit the campus before applying?
q5.answer: Absolutely! We encourage prospective families to visit our campus. Please contact our admission office to schedule a guided tour. Campus visits are available Saturday through Thursday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

q6.question: What is the medium of instruction?
q6.answer: Our primary medium of instruction is Bengali, following the NCTB curriculum. English is taught as a subject, and Islamic studies are conducted in Arabic with Bengali explanations. We ensure students develop proficiency in all three languages.
